result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Scott Sachsenmaier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Scott Sachsenmaier is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Scott Sachsenmaier was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony, Requirement for Ignition Interlock Device, Penalty - Operating While Under the Influence (4th w/in 5 yrs)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Count 2.
Court notes 80 days credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

miscConds.notes: Apply bond on file and balance to be paid through a payment plan with Clerk of Court.
Blood draw. To be added to payment plan.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF165 and 15TR1565:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. DA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Julie A. Weber   DF:  Daniel Scott Sachsenmaier appeared. Case called at 1:35 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing. DA Nieskes recites agreement and recommendations. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 OWI 4 w/in 5 years in 15CF165. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 OWI 4 w/in 5 years  in      15CF165. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CF165 and 15TR1565. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. 

Crt orders:

In Count 1 in file 15CF165:

- S/W 3 years probation

- Impose 9 month conditional jail time. Must serve 6 months starting today and the final 3 months will be stayed. 80 days of jail credit if revoked from probation. Huber granted for work and treatment
-  AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

- $52.00 Blood Draw fee payable to SCSO

- DNA Sample

- 36 month drivers license revocation. Credit for administrative suspension

- 36 month IID

- $1,744.00 fine. DE to set up a payment plan. Payments to begin February 1, 2017
